title.title: Using the air conditioning system and defogger

indexmarker.marker: Air conditioning system:Manual air conditioning system

p.p: If equipped
To adjust the temperature setting, turn the temperature control switch clockwise to decrease the temperature.
To adjust the temperature setting, turn the temperature control switch clockwise (warm) or counterclockwise (cool).

p_sub.p_sub: If “A/C” switch is not pressed, the system will blow ambient temperature air or heated air.

p.p: To adjust the fan speed, turn the fan speed control switch clockwise (increase) or counterclockwise (decrease).

p_sub.p_sub: When the fan is off, turning the fan speed control switch clockwise will turn on the fan.

p.p: To select the air outlets, set the airflow mode control switch to the desired position.

title.title: Switching between outside air and recirculated air modes

p.p: Press the outside/recirculated air mode switch.

title.title: Set cooling and dehumidification function (vehicles with the “A/C” switch)

p.p: Press the “A/C” switch.

p_sub.p_sub: When the function is on, the indicator illuminates on the “A/C” switch.

p.p: Defoggers are used to defog the windshield and front side windows.
Turn the airflow mode control switch to the windshield defogger position.

p_sub.p_sub: Change the air mode to outside air mode if it is currently set to recirculated air mode. (The mode may change automatically.)
To defog the windshield and the side windows quickly, turn the air flow and temperature up.
Vehicles with the “A/C” switch: If the dehumidification function is not operating, press “A/C” switch to operate the dehumidification function.

p.p: A defogger is used to defog the rear window.
Press the rear window defogger switch.

p_sub.p_sub: The defogger will automatically turn off after a while.
When the rear window defogger switch is on, the indicator illuminates on the rear window defogger switch.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Vehicles with the “A/C” switch: The windows will easily fog up when the humidity in the vehicle is high. Turning “A/C” switch is on will dehumidify the air from the outlets and defog the windshield effectively.
Vehicles with the “A/C” switch: If you turn “A/C” switch is off, the windows may fog up more easily.
The windows may fog up if the recirculated air mode is used.

p.p: Close all windows. If dust thrown up by the vehicle is still drawn into the vehicle after closing the windows, it is recommended that the air intake mode be set to outside air mode and the fan speed to any setting except off.
Setting to the recircurated air mode temporarily is recommended in preventing dirty air from entering the vehicle interior and helping to cool the vehicle when the outside air temperature is high.

title.title: When the outside temperature is low (vehicles with the “A/C” switch)

p.p: The air conditioning system may not operate even when “A/C” switch is pressed.

itemtxt.itemtxt: To let fresh air in, set the air conditioning system to the outside air mode.
During use, various odors from inside and outside the vehicle may enter into and accumulate in the air conditioning system. This may then cause odor to be emitted from the vents.
It is recommended that the air conditioning system be set to outside air mode prior to turning the vehicle off.
To reduce potential odors from occurring: It is recommended that the air conditioning system be set to outside air mode prior to turning the vehicle off.

title.title: To prevent the windshield from fogging up

p.p: Do not set the airflow mode control switch to the windshield defogger position during cool air operation in extremely humid weather. The difference between the temperature of the outside air and that of the windshield can cause the outer surface of the windshield to fog up, blocking your vision.
Do not leave the air conditioning system on longer than necessary when the engine is off.
The air outlets and air volume changes according to the selected air flow mode.

title.title: Adjusting the position of and opening and closing the air outlets

p.p: Direct air flow to the left or right, up or down

callouttxt.callouttxt: Direct air flow to the left or right, up or down
Direct air flow to the left or right, up or down
Direct air flow to the left or right, up or down
Turn the knob to open or close the vents

title.title: To prevent the windshield defogger from operating improperly

p.p: Do not place anything on the instrument panel which may cover the air outlets. Otherwise, air flow may be obstructed, preventing the windshield defoggers from defogging.

indexmarker.marker: Air conditioning system:Automatic air conditioning system

p.p: If equipped

indexmarker.marker: Switches:Rear window and outside rear view mirror defoggers switch

title.title: Vehicles without DUAL mode air conditioning system

p.p: If equipped

title.title: Vehicles with DUAL mode air conditioning system

p.p: To adjust the temperature setting, turn the temperature control switch clockwise (warm) or counterclockwise (cool).

p_sub.p_sub: If “A/C” switch is not pressed, the system will blow ambient temperature air or heated air.

title.title: Vehicles without DUAL mode air conditioning system

p.p: To adjust the fan speed, turn the fan speed control switch clockwise (increase) or counterclockwise (decrease).

p_sub.p_sub: Pressing the off switch to turns off the fan.

title.title: Vehicles with DUAL mode air conditioning system

p.p: Operate the fan speed up switch to increase the fan speed and the fan speed down switch to decrease the fan speed.

p_sub.p_sub: Pressing the off switch to turns off the fan.

p.p: Press the airflow mode control switch.

p_sub.p_sub: The airflow mode changes as follows each time the switch is pressed.

title.title: Switching between outside air and recirculated air modes

itemtxt.itemtxt: To change to recirculated air mode, press the recirculated air mode switch.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: The indicator illuminates on the recirculated air mode switch.

itemtxt.itemtxt: To change to outside air mode, press the outside air mode switch.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: The indicator illuminates on the outside air mode switch.

p.p: Press the outside/recirculated air mode switch.
Press the “A/C” switch.

p_sub.p_sub: When the function is on, the indicator illuminates on the “A/C” switch.

p.p: Defoggers are used to defog the windshield and front side windows.
Press the windshield defogger switch.

p_sub.p_sub: Change the air mode to outside air mode if it is currently set to recirculated air mode. (The mode may change automatically.)
To defog the windshield and the side windows quickly, turn the air flow and temperature up.
To return to the previous mode, press the windshield defogger switch again when the windshield is defogged.
When the windshield defogger switch is on, the indicator illuminates on the windshield defogger switch.

p.p: A defogger is used to defog the rear window.
Press the rear window defogger switch.

p_sub.p_sub: The defogger will automatically turn off after a while.
When the rear window defogger switch is on, the indicator illuminates on the rear window defogger switch.

p.p: The air conditioning is controlled with low fuel consumption prioritized such as reducing fan speed, etc.
Press the eco air conditioning mode switch.

p_sub.p_sub: When the eco air conditioning mode is on, the indicator illuminates on the eco air conditioning mode switch.

p.p: In S-FLOW mode, priority for the airflow is given to the driver’s seat, reducing the airflow and air conditioning effect on the front passenger’s seat and rear seats.
When the S-FLOW mode switch is pressed, S-FLOW mode will be manually enabled/ disabled.

p_sub.p_sub: When the S-FLOW mode is on, the indicator illuminates on the S-FLOW mode switch and the temperature indicator for the passenger side will turn off.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The windows will easily fog up when the humidity in the vehicle is high. Turning “A/C” on will dehumidify the air from the outlets and defog the windshield effectively.
If you turn “A/C” off, the windows may fog up more easily.
The windows may fog up if the recirculated air mode is used.

p.p: Close all windows. If dust thrown up by the vehicle is still drawn into the vehicle after closing the windows, it is recommended that the air intake mode be set to outside air mode and the fan speed to any setting except off.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Setting to the recircurated air mode temporarily is recommended in preventing dirty air from entering the vehicle interior and helping to cool the vehicle when the outside air temperature is high.
Outside/recirculated air mode may automatically switch depending on the temperature setting or the inside temperature.

title.title: When the outside temperature falls to nearly 0°C (32°F)

p.p: The dehumidification function may not operate even when “A/C” switch is pressed.

itemtxt.itemtxt: To let fresh air in, set the air conditioning system to the outside air mode.
During use, various odors from inside and outside the vehicle may enter into and accumulate in the air conditioning system. This may then cause odor to be emitted from the vents.
To reduce potential odors from occurring:
It is recommended that the air conditioning system be set to outside air mode prior to turning the vehicle off.
The start timing of the blower may be delayed for a short period of time immediately after the air conditioning system is started in automatic mode.

p.p: Saudi Arabia, Sultanate of Oman, Bahrain, United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Kuwait

itemtxt.itemtxt: When the fan is turned on, nanoe™ system is activated.
When the fan is operated in the following conditions, system performance will be maximized. If the following conditions are not met, nanoe™ may not operate at full capacity.
The passenger’s side vent is open.

When nanoe™ is generated, a small amount of ozone is emitted and may be faintly smelled in some situations. However, this is approximately the same as the amount that already exists in nature, such as in forests, and it has no affect on the human body.
A slight noise may be heard during operation. This is not a malfunction.

p.p: nanoe™ and the nanoe™ mark are trademarks of Panasonic Corporation.
According to temperature and humidity conditions, fan speed and direction of the air flow, nanoe™ may not operate at full capacity.

title.title: To prevent the windshield from fogging up

p.p: Do not use the windshield defogger switch during cool air operation in extremely humid weather. The difference between the temperature of the outside air and that of the windshield can cause the outer surface of the windshield to fog up, blocking your vision.
Do not disassemble or repair the generator because it contains high voltage parts. Contact your Toyota dealer if the generator needs repair.
Do not leave the air conditioning system on longer than necessary when the engine is off.

title.title: To prevent damage to the nanoe™ (if equipped)

p.p: Do not insert anything into the passenger’s side vent, attach anything to it, or use sprays around the passenger’s side vent. These things may cause the generator not to work properly.

steptxt.steptxt: To stop the operation, press the off switch.

p.p: If the fan speed setting or air flow modes are operated, the automatic mode indicator goes off. However, automatic mode for functions other than that operated is maintained.
Fan speed is adjusted automatically according to the temperature setting and the ambient conditions.
Therefore, the fan may stop for a while until warm or cool air is ready to flow immediately after the automatic mode switch pressed.

title.title: Adjusting the temperature for the driver and front passenger seat separately (vehicles with DUAL mode air conditioning system)

p.p: To turn on the “DUAL” mode, perform any of the following procedures:

itemtxt.itemtxt: Press the “DUAL” switch.
Adjust the front passenger’s side temperature setting.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: The indicator on the “DUAL” switch comes on when the “DUAL” mode is on.
Pressing the “DUAL” switch when in “DUAL” mode will disable “DUAL” mode, and the temperature setting for the front passenger’s side will become linked to the driver’s side.

p.p: The air outlets and air volume changes according to the selected air flow mode.

title.title: Adjusting the position of and opening and closing the air outlets

p.p: Direct air flow to the left or right, up or down

callouttxt.callouttxt: Direct air flow to the left or right, up or down
Direct air flow to the left or right, up or down
Direct air flow to the left or right, up or down
Turn the knob to open or close the vents

title.title: To prevent the windshield defogger from operating improperly

p.p: Do not place anything on the instrument panel which may cover the air outlets. Otherwise, air flow may be obstructed, preventing the windshield defoggers from defogging.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: When a door is opened while the door position is on, the lights turn on.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Type A

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: When a door is opened while the door position is on, the lights turn on.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Type B

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: When a door is opened while the door position is on, the lights turn on.

p.p: Turns the lights on/off
Turns the lights on/off

The lights automatically turn on/off according to the engine switch mode (position), the presence of the electronic key (vehicles with a smart entry & start system), whether the doors are locked/unlocked, and whether the doors are opened/closed.

title.title: To prevent the battery from being discharged

p.p: If the interior lights remain on when the engine switch is turned off, the lights will go off automatically after 20 minutes.

title.title: The interior lights may turn on automatically when

p.p: Do not leave the lights on longer than necessary when the engine is not running.

title.title: Items that should not be left in the storage spaces

p.p: Do not leave glasses, lighters or spray cans in the storage spaces, as this may cause the following when cabin temperature becomes high:

itemtxt.itemtxt: Glasses may be deformed by heat or cracked if they come into contact with other stored items.
Lighters or spray cans may explode. If they come into contact with other stored items, the lighter may catch fire or the spray can may release gas, causing a fire hazard.

p.p: Pull up the lever to open the glove box.
The glove box light turns on when the tail lights are on.
Keep the glove box closed. In the event of sudden braking or sudden swerving, an accident may occur due to an occupant being struck by the open glove box or the items stored inside.
Pull the armrest down.

title.title: Items unsuitable for the cup holder

itemtxt.itemtxt: When storing a bottle, close the cap.
The bottle may not be stored depending on its size or shape.

title.title: Items unsuitable for the bottle holders
Items that should be not stowed in the bottle holders

p.p: Do not place open bottles or glass and paper cups containing liquid in the bottle holders. The contents may spill and glasses may break.
Lift the lid while pulling up the knob.

Observe the following precautions when putting items in the open tray. Failure to do so may cause items to be thrown out of the tray in the event of sudden braking or steering. In these cases, the items may interfere with pedal operation or cause driver distraction, resulting in an accident.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not store items in the tray that can easily shift or roll out.
Do not stack items in the tray higher than the tray’s edge.
Do not put items in the tray that may protrude over the tray’s edge.

p.p: Lift the deck mat.
Depending on the external device, it may not charge properly. Refer to the manual included with the device before using a USB charging port.
Lift the lid while pulling up the knob.

title.title: The USB charging port can be used when

p.p: The engine switch is in ACC or ON.

title.title: Situations in which the USB charging port may not operate correctly

itemtxt.itemtxt: If a device which consumes more than 2.1 A at 5 V is connected
If a device designed to communicate with a personal computer, such as a USB memory device, is connected
If the connected external device is turned off (depending on device)
If the temperature inside the vehicle is high, such as after the vehicle has been parked in the sun

p.p: Depending on the connected external device, charging may occasionally be suspended and then start again. This is not a malfunction.

title.title: To prevent damage to the USB charging port

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not insert foreign objects into the port.
Do not spill water or other liquids into the port.
Do not apply excessive force to or impact the USB charging port.
Do not disassemble or modify the USB charging port.

title.title: To prevent damage to external devices

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not leave external devices in the vehicle. The temperature inside the vehicle may become high, resulting in damage to an external device.
Do not push down on or apply unnecessary force to an external device or the cable of an external device while it is connected.

p.p: Do not use the USB charging port for a long period of time with the engine stopped.
The power outlet can be used for 12 V accessories that run on less than 10 A.
Open the console box lid and open the lid.

title.title: The power outlet can be used when

p.p: The engine switch is in ACC or ON.

title.title: When turning the engine switch off

p.p: Disconnect electrical devices with charging functions, such as mobile battery packs. If such devices are left connected, the engine switch may not be turned off normally.

title.title: To prevent the fuse from being blown

p.p: Do not use an accessory that uses more than 12 V 10 A.

title.title: To avoid damaging the power outlet
To prevent the battery from being discharged

p.p: Do not use the power outlet longer than necessary when the engine is not running.

A portable device, such as a smartphone or mobile battery, can be charged by just placing it on the charging area, provided the device is compatible with the Qi wireless charging standard created by the Wireless Power Consortium.

The wireless charger cannot be used with a portable device that is larger than the charging area. Additionally, depending on the portable device, the wireless charger may not operate properly. Refer to the operation manual of the portable device.
The “Qi” symbol is a trademark of the Wireless Power Consortium.

steptxt.steptxt: Press the power supply switch of the wireless charger.
Place a portable device on the charging area with its charging surface facing down.

itemtxt.itemtxt: If a certain amount of time has elapsed since charging completed and the portable device has not been moved, the wireless charger will restart charging.
If the portable device is moved within the charging area, charging will stop temporarily then restart.

p.p: Operation indicator light
State
Off
The Wireless charger is off
Green (illuminated)
Standby (charging is possible)
Orange (illuminated)
A portable device has been placed on the charging area (identifying the portable device)
Charging in progress
Depending on the portable device, the operation indicator light may stay illuminated (orange) after charging has completed.

itemtxt.itemtxt: If the operation indicator light blinks

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: If an error is detected, the operation indicator light will blink (orange). Take the appropriate measures according to the table below.

p.p: Operation indicator light
Suspected cause
Measure
Blinks (orange) at a one second interval continuously
Vehicle to charger communication failure.
Contact your Toyota dealer.
Blinks (orange) 3 times repeatedly
A foreign object exists between the portable device and charging area.
Remove the foreign object.
Portable device is not positioned properly on the charging area.
Move the portable device toward the center of the charging area.
Blinks (orange) 4 times repeatedly
The temperature of the wireless charger is excessively high.
Stop charging immediately and continue charging after a while.

title.title: The wireless charger can be operated when

p.p: The engine switch is in ACC or ON.

title.title: Portable devices that can be charged

itemtxt.itemtxt: Portable devices compatible with the Qi wireless charging standard can be charged by the wireless charger. However, compatibility with all devices which meet the Qi wireless charging standard is not guaranteed.
The wireless charger is designed to supply low power electricity (5 W or less) to a cellular phone, smartphone, or other portable device.

title.title: If a cover or accessory is attached to the portable device

p.p: Do not charge a portable device if a cover or accessory which is not Qi compatible is attached. Depending on the type of cover and/or accessory attached, it may not be possible to charge the portable device. If the portable device is placed on the charging area and does not charge, remove the cover and/or accessories.

title.title: If interference is heard in AM radio broadcasts while charging

p.p: Turn off the wireless charger and check if the noise is reduced. If noise is reduced, press and hold the power supply switch of the wireless charger for 2 seconds. The frequency of the wireless charger is changed and noise may be reduced. When the frequency is changed, the operation indicator light will blink (orange) 2 times.

itemtxt.itemtxt: If the electronic key cannot be detected in the cabin, charging cannot be performed. When a door is opened and closed, charging may be temporarily suspended.

p.p: When the power supply switch is turned on or while a portable device is being identified, operation sounds may be heard. This is not a malfunction.
When charging a portable device while driving, for safety reasons, the driver should not operate the portable device.

title.title: Caution regarding interference with electronic devices

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not put any metallic objects between the charging area and the portable device while charging.
Do not attach metallic objects, such as aluminum stickers, to the charging area.
Do not cover the wireless charger with a cloth or other object while charging.
Do not attempt to charge portable devices which are not compatible with the Qi wireless charging standard.
Do not disassemble, modify or remove the wireless charger.
Do not apply force or impact to the wireless charger.

title.title: Conditions in which the wireless charger may not operate correctly

p.p: In the following situations, the wireless charger may not operate correctly:

itemtxt.itemtxt: When a portable device is fully charged
When there is a foreign object between the charging area and portable device
When a portable device becomes hot while charging
When a portable device is placed on the wireless area with its charging surface facing up
When a portable device is not centered on the charging area
When the vehicle is near a TV tower, electric power plant, gas station, radio station, large display, airport or other facility that generates strong radio waves or electrical noise
When the portable device is in contact with, or is covered by any of the following metallic objects:
Cards to which aluminum foil is attached
Cigarette boxes that have aluminum foil inside
Metallic wallets or bags
Coins
Metal hand warmers
Media such as CDs and DVDs
When wireless keys (that emit radio waves) other than those of your vehicle are being used nearby.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: If in situations other than above the wireless charger does not operate properly or the operation indicator light is blinking, the wireless charger may be malfunctioning. Contact your Toyota dealer.

title.title: To prevent failure or damage to data

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not leave portable devices in the cabin. The temperature inside the cabin may become high when parked in the sun, and cause damage to the device.

p.p: Do not use the wireless charger for a long period of time with the engine stopped.

callouttxt.callouttxt: To set the visor in the forward position, flip it down.
To set the visor in the side position, flip down, unhook, and swing it to the side.

p.p: Slide the cover to open.

p_sub.p_sub: The vanity light turns on. (if equipped)

title.title: To prevent battery discharge (vehicles with vanity lights)

p.p: If the vanity lights remain on when the engine switch is OFF, the lights will go off automatically after 20 minutes.

title.title: To prevent the battery from being discharged (vehicles with vanity lights)

p.p: Do not leave the vanity lights on for extended periods while the engine is stopped.
Fold down the armrest for use.

title.title: To prevent damage to the armrest

p.p: Do not apply too much load on the armrest.
Pull the tab of the shade and hook the shade on the anchors.
To lower the shade, pull the tab slightly to unhook the shade, and lower it slowly.

title.title: To ensure normal operation of the sunshade

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not place anything where it may hinder the opening/closing of the shade.
Do not place anything on the shade.

p.p: An assist grip installed on the ceiling can be used to support your body while sitting on the seat.
Do not use the assist grip when getting in or out of the vehicle or rising from your seat.

title.title: To prevent damage to the assist grip

p.p: Do not hang any heavy object or put a heavy load on the assist grip.
The coat hooks are provided with the rear assist grips.

title.title: Items that cannot be hung on the coat hook (vehicles with SRS curtain shield airbags)

p.p: Do not hang coat hangers or other hard or sharp objects on the hook. If the SRS curtain shield airbags deploy, these items may become projectiles, causing death or serious injury.
